solution.text:
Let a be the first term and r be the common ratio of the G.P.
a=_{p}_
it is known that, \(a_n=ar^{n-1}\)
\(a_4=ar^3=_{p}_r^3\)
\(a_2=ar^1=_{p}_r\)
According to given conditions
\(_{p}_r^3=[_{p}_r]^2\)
\(_{p}_r^3=_{{p**2}}_r^2\)
\(r=_{p}_\)
\(a__{q}_=ar^{_{{q-1}}_}=_{{p**q}}_\)
Thus, Seventh term is of the G.P. is _{{p**q}}_

content.text: The \(4^{th}\) term of a G.P is square of its second term, and the first term is _{p}_. Find its _{q}_\(^{th}\) term.
